item.title: Rubbish in alley to right of Sainsbury's, 12th June
item.description:
We had the same issue in June last year as was reported to our Managing agents, Acorn on 23June 2024, however the level of rubbish has escalated. We are given to understand by the Manager at Sainsburys Local, Brampton Road that this waste/rubbish is not there's and she checked with the Take-away shop next to Sainsburys who said they have their own bins inside their premises the same applied to Expo International Supermarket, the Manager suggested the residents of the flats above the takeaway shop and other shops in that parade were more than likely responsible for the rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous materials - Asbestos roofing, 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling Way, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green littered with flytipping again, 12th June
item.description:
Shortly after the bag was collected the previous time the green has now been lifted again with rubbish. What looks like tissues and nappies lying by the tree hidden among the long grass that hasn’t been cut and then you’ve got somebody’s TV box that has been thrown open there with all of their dirty rubbish inside and rubbish bags, honestly This never ends when the council eventually collect the one pile of rubbish. Another one starts piling up it’s as if this has become the local flight tipping spot and it’s absolutely tiring to look at every day when we walk past I walk my daughter past you to get to school. It’s disgusting and I’ve asked several times for an alternate that the council come to put bins up watches or put up a warning sign but they don’t and they very rarely clean the mess. People use this as a dumping spot all the time something has to be done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westhorne Avenue, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
